Events for Sustainable Futures

This module introduces you to the theoretical principles for understanding the events industry with a specific focus on the contemporary societal challenges of sustainability. You will be introduced to contemporary debates within event studies on the social and environmental impacts of events and the alignment to principles of sustainability. You will gain a broad understanding of the events industry through case studies on the strategic use of events as tools for change, utilising international examples form a range of event contexts including business events, festivals, arts and cultural events and sport. You will be introduced to a range of academic, industry and policy materials related to the sustainable management of events and the module's focus on critical inquiry and evidence-based arguments will equip you with key academic skills for study at a higher education level for successful academic performance.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Understand and apply the theories and concepts that underpin our understanding of events as strategic tools for change.

+  Recognise the principles of sustainability and assess its relevance to the future of the events industry.

+  Demonstrate an ability to organise and evaluate published research and make evidence-based arguments.

+  Evaluate and critique the sustainable management of events.
